member.name: T:Rewired.ActionIdPropertyAttribute
member.summary: A PropertyAttribute for an InputAction id. Use on a serialized int field to allow selecting of Rewired Actions from a popup in the Unity inspector. Usage: [ActionIdProperty(typeof(MyType)] Type should be a class that contains public const int fields, each of which corresponds to a Rewired Input Action id.

member.name: M:Rewired.ActionIdPropertyAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.
member.param: Type containing public const int fields or a System.Enum:int.

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Attributes.PreserveAttribute
member.summary: Use to preserve things from IL2CPP stripping. Usage: - Assembly: preserves all types in the assembly (as if a preserve attribute were on each type) - Type: preserves the type and its default constructor - Method: preserves the methods declaring type, return type, and a the types of all of its arguments - Property, Field, Event: preserves the declaring type and return type

member.name: T:Rewired.PlayerIdPropertyAttribute
member.summary: A PropertyAttribute for a Player id. Use on a serialized int field to allow selecting of Rewired Players from a popup in the Unity inspector. Usage: [PlayerIdProperty(typeof(MyType)] Type should be a class that contains public const int fields, each of which corresponds to a Rewired Player id.

member.name: M:Rewired.PlayerIdPropertyAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.
member.param: Type containing public const int fields or a System.Enum:int.

member.name: T:Rewired.ControllerStatusChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Event args returned by controller connect and disconnect events. Contains information about the controller that was changed.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerStatusChangedEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerType)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerStatusChangedEventArgs.name
member.summary: The name of the controller.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerStatusChangedEventArgs.controllerId
member.summary: The id of the controller. This can be used along with controllerType to get the controller. For joysticks, this is equal to Joystick.id.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerStatusChangedEventArgs.controllerType
member.summary: The type of the controller. This can be used along with controllerId to get the controller.

member.name: T:Rewired.InputActionEventData
member.summary: Event data returned by an Input Action update event. Use this to get information about the input event.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventData.playerId
member.summary: The Player Id of the Player that generated this event.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventData.actionId
member.summary: The Action Id of Action this event is for.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventData.updateLoop
member.summary: The update loop this event was called in.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxis
member.summary: Gets the axis value of an Action.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisPrev
member.summary: Gets the axis value of an Action during the previous frame..

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisDelta
member.summary: Gets the change in axis value of an Action since the previous frame..

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisTimeActive
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that an axis has been continuously active. Returns 0 if the axis is not currently active.
member.returns: The duration the axis has been continuously active.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisTimeInactive
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that an axis has been inactive. Returns 0 if the axis is currently active.
member.returns: The duration the axis has been continuously inactive.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisRaw
member.summary: Gets the raw axis value of an Action. The raw value excludes any digital axis simulation modification by the Input Behavior assigned to this Action. This raw value is modified by deadzone and axis calibration settings in the controller. To get truly raw values, you must get the raw value directly from the Controller element.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisRawDelta
member.summary: Gets the change in raw axis value of an Action since the previous frame. The raw value excludes any digital axis simulation modification by the Input Behavior assigned to this Action. This raw value is modified by deadzone and axis calibration settings in the controller. To get truly raw values, you must get the raw value directly from the Controller element.
member.returns: The change in raw axis value.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisRawPrev
member.summary: Gets the raw axis value of an Action during the previous frame. The raw value excludes any digital axis simulation modification by the Input Behavior assigned to this Action. This raw value is modified by deadzone and axis calibration settings in the controller. To get truly raw values, you must get the raw value directly from the Controller element.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisRawTimeActive
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that an axis has been continuously active as calculated from the raw value. Returns 0 if the axis is not currently active.
member.returns: The duration the raw axis has been continuously active.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetAxisRawTimeInactive
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that an axis has been inactive as calculated from the raw value. Returns 0 if the axis is currently active.
member.returns: The duration the axis has been continuously inactive.

members.member: Gets the current coordinate mode of the axis. This can be used to detect whether the axis is returning a delta value (mouse, touchpad, etc.) or an absolute value (joystick). The axis coordinate mode.

Gets the coordinate mode of the axis on the previous frame. This can be used to detect whether the axis is returning a delta value (mouse, touchpad, etc.) or an absolute value (joystick). The axis coordinate mode.

Gets the current coordinate mode of the raw axis. This can be used to detect whether the axis is returning a delta value (mouse, touchpad, etc.) or an absolute value (joystick). The raw axis coordinate mode.

Gets the coordinate mode of the raw axis on the previous frame. This can be used to detect whether the axis is returning a delta value (mouse, touchpad, etc.) or an absolute value (joystick). The raw axis coordinate mode.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButton
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action. This will return TRUE as long as the button is held. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonPrev
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action during the previous frame.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonDown
member.summary: Gets the button just pressed state of an Action. This will only return TRUE only on the first frame the button is pressed or for the duration of the Button Down Buffer time limit if set in the Input Behavior assigned to this Action. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonUp
member.summary: Get the button just released state for an Action. This will only return TRUE for the first frame the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonDoublePressDown(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button double pressed state of an Action. This will return TRUE only on the first frame of a double press.
member.param: Allowed time for a double press in seconds.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonDoublePressHold(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button double pressed and held state of an Action. This will return TRUE after a double press and the button is then held.
member.param: Allowed time for a double press in seconds.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonDoublePressUp(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button double pressed and just released state of an Action. This will return TRUE only on the first frame after double press is released.
member.param: Allowed time for a double press in seconds.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimedPress(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimedPress(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true.
Time in seconds after activation that the press will expire. Once expired, it will no longer return true even if held. [0 = Never expire]

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimedPressDown(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for the specified time. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimedPressUp(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time and then released. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for at least the specified time and then released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true when released.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimedPressUp(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time and then released. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for at least the specified time and then released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true when released.
Time in seconds after activation that the press will expire. Once expired, it will no longer return true even if released. [0 = Never expire]

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonShortPress
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button short press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPress instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonShortPressDown
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for the specified time. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button short press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPressDown instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonShortPressUp
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time and then released. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for at least the specified time and then released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button short press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPressUp instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonLongPress
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button long press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPress instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonLongPressDown
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for the specified time. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button long press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPressDown instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonLongPressUp
member.summary: Gets the button state of an Action after being held for a period of time and then released. This will return TRUE only on the frame in which the button had been held for at least the specified time and then released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons. The button long press time is set in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. For a custom duration, use GetButtonTimedPressUp instead.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonRepeating
member.summary: Gets the repeating button state of an Action. This will return TRUE when immediately pressed, then FALSE until the Input Behaviour button repeat delay has elapsed, then TRUE for a 1-frame duration repeating at the interval specified in the Input Behavior assigned to the Action. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimePressed
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that a button has been continuously held down. Returns 0 if the button is not currently pressed.
member.returns: The duration of the button hold.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetButtonTimeUnpressed
member.summary: Gets the length of time in seconds that a button has not been pressed. Returns 0 if the button is currently pressed.
member.returns: The duration of the button inactivity.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetNegativeButton
member.summary: Gets the negative button held state of an Action. This will return TRUE as long as the negative button is held. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetNegativeButtonPrev
member.summary: Gets the negative button held state of an Action during the previous frame.
member.returns: The previous negative button held state

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetNegativeButtonDown
member.summary: Gets the negative button just pressed state of an Action. This will only return TRUE only on the first frame the negative button is pressed or for the duration of the Button Down Buffer time limit if set in the Input Behavior assigned to this Action. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.returns: The negative button just pressed state

member.name: M:Rewired.InputActionEventData.GetNegativeButtonUp
member.summary: Get the negative button just released state for all Actions. This will only return TRUE for the first frame the negative button is released. This will return TRUE each time any negative button is released even if others are being held down. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.returns: The negative button just released state

member.returns: The negative button just pressed state

member.name: T:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo
member.summary: Contains polling information recieved from a controller element polling request. Use this to determine which controller element was activated for use in control remapping.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.success
member.summary: Was user input detected? If false, no user input was detected.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.playerId
member.summary: The player id that generated this input. This value is only valid if the controller is assigned to a Player and polling was called on or through Player.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.controllerId
member.summary: The id of the controller that returned input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.controllerName
member.summary: The name of the controller that returned input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.controllerType
member.summary: The type of the controller that returned input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.elementType
member.summary: The type of element on the controller that returned input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.elementIndex
member.summary: The index to the controller element that returned input. In combination with controllerType, this can be used to determine the exact button or axis index.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.axisPole
member.summary: The pole of the axis that was activated (+/-). This is only relevant if elementType is Axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.elementIdentifierName
member.summary: The name of the element identifier on the controller that returned input. This gives you the human-readable name of the element such as Left Stick X -.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.elementIdentifierId
member.summary: The id of the element identifier on the controller that returned input. This points back to the human-readable element identifier on a controller such as Left Stick X. This is used when creating an ActionElementMap in a ControllerMap to associate a controller element with an Action.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.keyboardKey
member.summary: The keyboard key that returned input. This is only valid if controllerType is Keyboard.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.player
member.summary: The Player that generated this input. This value is only valid if the controller is assigned to a Player and polling was called on or through Player.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.controller
member.summary: The controller that returned input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ControllerPollingInfo.elementIdentifier
member.summary: The controller element identifier that returned input.

member.name: T:Rewired.ElementAssignmentConflictCheck
member.summary: A struct for performing a controller element assignment conflict check.

member.name: M:Rewired.ElementAssignmentConflictCheck.#ctor(System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,Rewired.ElementAssignmentType,System.Int32,Rewired.AxisRange,UnityEngine.KeyCode,Rewired.ModifierKeyFlags,System.Int32,Rewired.Pole,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A struct for use in element assignment conflict checking. Overload for complete assignment.
member.param: The Player that is being assigned to.
The type of controller that is being assigned to.
The id of the controller that is being assigned to.
The unique id of the controller map that is being assigned to. Corresponds to ControllerMap.id.
The type of the desired assignment.
The element identifier id of the controller element that is being assigned.
The range of the axis that is being assigned. (Only used for axis assignments.)
The keyboard key that is being assigned. (Only used for keyboard assignments.)
The modifiers keys for the keyboard key that is being assigned. (Only used for keyboard assignments.)
The id of the Action being assigned.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchInteractableTransitioner
member.summary: Allows synchronization of transition states between a Touch Interactable and a Graphic. Add this component to children of touch controls that need transition states or visibility to remain in sync with the parent. This is useful for Text or Image components parented underneath a touch control for example. This allows you to add graphics, text, or other decorations on your touch control and have them animate colors, sprite transitions, etc. in sync with the parent control.

member.summary: A touch joystick control.

member.summary: Gets the calibrated value of the joystick.

member.summary: Gets the raw value of the joystick.

member.summary: Set the raw value of the joystick.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.SetDefaultPosition
member.summary: Record the current anchored position as the joystick's default position. The joystick will return to this position when released when using a Touch Region with moveToTouchPosition set to True. If you move the joystick's position and want it to return there next time, you should record the new default position by calling this method.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.SetDefaultAnchoredPosition(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the joystick's default position. The joystick will return to this position when released when using a Touch Region with moveToTouchPosition set to True. If you move the joystick's position and want it to return there next time, you should record the new default position by calling this method.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.ReturnToDefaultPosition(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the joystick to the default position.
member.param: Snap to the position immediately, otherwise use movement animation settings.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.ReturnToDefaultPosition
member.summary: Moves the joystick to the default position.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.OnClear
member.summary: Clears the control completely including all internal states.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.horizontalAxisCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element(s) that will receive input values from the joystick's X axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.verticalAxisCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element(s) that will receive input values from the joystick's Y axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.tapCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from taps.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.stickTransform
member.summary: The Rect Transform of the stick disc. This is moved around by the user when manipulating the joystick.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.joystickMode
member.summary: The joystick's mode of operation. Set this to Digital to simulate a D-Pad which has only On/Off states. If you want mimic a real D-Pad, you should also set Snap Directions to 8.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.digitalModeDeadZone
member.summary: A dead zone which is applied when Stick Mode is set to Digital. This is used to filter out tiny stick movements near 0, 0.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.stickRange
member.summary: The range of movement of the stick in Canvas pixels. The larger the number, the further the stick must be moved from center to register movement.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.scaleStickRange
member.summary: If enabled, the stick range will scale with parent controls. Otherwise, the stick range will remain constant.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.stickBounds
member.summary: The shape of the range of movement of the joystick.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.axesToUse
member.summary: The axis directions in which movement is allowed. You can restrict movement to one or both axes.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.snapDirections
member.summary: Snaps joystick movement to a fixed number of directions. This can be used to create a D-Pad, for example, setting it to 4 or 8 directions. If you want a true D-Pad, Stick Mode should be set to digital.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.snapStickToTouch
member.summary: If true, the stick disc will snap immediately to the touch position when initially touched. This results in the stick disc being centered to the touch position. This will cause the stick to generate input immediately when touched if not touched perfectly centered. If false, the stick disc will remain in its current position on touch, and when dragged will retain the same offset. The stick's center point will be set to the position of the touch. The initial touch will not cause the stick to pop in any direction.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.centerStickOnRelease
member.summary: If true, the stick will return to the center after it is released. Otherwise, the stick will remain in the last position and continue to return input.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.activateOnSwipeIn
member.summary: If true, the joystick can be activated by a touch swipe that began in an area outside the joystick region. If false, the joystick can only be activated by a direct touch.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.stayActiveOnSwipeOut
member.summary: If true, the joystick will stay engaged even if the touch that activated it moves outside the joystick region. If false, the joystick will be released once the touch that activated it moves outside the joystick region.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.allowTap
member.summary: Should taps on the touch pad be processed?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.tapTimeout
member.summary: The maximum touch duration allowed for the touch to be considered a tap.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.tapDistanceLimit
member.summary: The maximum movement distance allowed in pixels since the touch began for the touch to be considered a tap. [-1 = no limit]

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.touchRegion
member.summary: Optional external region to use for hover/click/touch detection. If set, this region will be used for touch detection instead of or in addition to the joystick's RectTransform. This can be useful if you want a larger area of the screen to act as a joystick.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.useTouchRegionOnly
member.summary: If True, hovers/clicks/touches on the local joystick will be ignored and only Touch Region touches will be used. Otherwise, both touches on the joystick and on the Touch Region will be used. This also applies to mouse hover. This setting has no effect if no Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.moveToTouchPosition
member.summary: If True, the joystick will move to the location of the current touch in the Touch Region. This can be used to designate an area of the screen as a hot-spot for a joystick and have the joystick graphics follow the users touches. This only has an effect if a Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.returnOnRelease
member.summary: If Move To Touch Position is enabled, this will make the joystick return to its original position after the press is released. This only has an effect if a Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.followTouchPosition
member.summary: If True, the joystick will follow the touch around until released. This setting overrides Move To Touch Position.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.animateOnMoveToTouch
member.summary: Should the joystick animate when moving to the touch point? This only has an effect if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set. This setting is ignored if Follow Touch Position is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.moveToTouchSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the joystick will move toward the touch position measured in screens per second (based on the larger of width and height). [1.0 = Move 1 screen/sec]. This only has an effect if Move To Touch Position is True, Animate On Move To Touch is true, and a Touch Region is set. This setting is ignored if Follow Touch Position is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.animateOnReturn
member.summary: Should the joystick animate when moving back to its original position? This only has an effect if Follow Touch Position is True, or if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set, and Return on Release is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.returnSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the joystick will move back toward its original position measured in screens per second (based on the larger of width and height). [1.0 = Move 1 screen/sec]. This only has an effect if Follow Touch Position is True, or if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set, and Return on Release and Animate on Return are both True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.manageRaycasting
member.summary: If True, it will attempt to automatically manage Graphic component raycasting for best results based on your current settings.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.horizontalAxisCalibration
member.summary: The calibration settings for the horizontal axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.verticalAxisCalibration
member.summary: The calibration settings for the vertical axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.deadZoneType
member.summary: The calibration settings for the 2D axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.pointerId
member.summary: The pointer id that currently has control of this joystick. If there is no pointer id, the value is TouchControl.POINTER_ID_NULL. Only one pointer id (touch, mouse, etc.) may be in control of this joystick at any time.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.hasPointer
member.summary: Is this joystick currently being controlled by a touch or pointer?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.axis2D
member.summary: The underlying 2D axis.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.ValueChangedEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the joystick value changes.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.StickPositionChangedEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the joystick's stick position changes.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchJoystick.TapEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the touch pad is tapped. This event will only be sent if allowTap is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.visible
member.summary: Is the effect visible?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.targetAngleFromRotation
member.summary: If enabled, the target angle will be determined by the transform's Local Rotation Z. Otherwise, the activation angle must be manually set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.targetAngle
member.summary: The joystick angle at which this object should be considered fully active.\n0 = up with negative values increase rotating clockwise. Example: -45 degrees = up-right.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.fadeWithValue
member.summary: If enabled, the color will fade in and out based on the current joystick value.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.fadeWithAngle
member.summary: If enabled, the color will fade in and out based on the current joystick angle. As the angle approaches the Target Angle, the color will become more intense.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.fadeRange
member.summary: The angle of rotation away from the Target Angle where the color fully fades out. If Fade with Angle is enabled, this is used to determine when the color will fully fade out when the joystick angle rotates away from the the Target Angle. This should be set to 1/2 of the complete rotation arc. Example: A value of 45 degrees would make the color fully fade out when the joystick angle is 45 degrees away from the Target Angle on either side, giving a complete arc of 90 degrees.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.activeColor
member.summary: The color when fully active.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.normalColor
member.summary: The color when not active.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.image
member.summary: Gets the Image attached to this GameObject.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.currentSprite
member.summary: Gets the current Sprite being used by the Image component. If an Override Sprite is set, that is returned. Otherwise, the Sprite is returned.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickAngleIndicator.rectTransform
member.summary: Gets the RectTransform attached to this GameObject.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator
member.summary: Arranges child TouchJoystickAngleIndicator objects in a radial pattern. It is useful for displaying direction indicators for a Touch Joystick in a radial pattern. Assists with scaling and sizing of the child images.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.scale
member.summary: If enabled, the indicators will be scaled based on the size of the RectTransform.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.preserveSpriteAspectRatio
member.summary: If enabled, the aspect ratio will be determined from the Sprite's texture.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.scaleRatio
member.summary: The scale ratio of the indicators to the current RectTransform's height. A ratio of 0.1 means the indicator will be 0.1 times the size of the RectTransform's height. This is useful if you need to be able to scale the transform and have the indicators also scale with it.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.aspectRatioX
member.summary: The horizontal component of the desired aspect ratio of the indicator.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.aspectRatioY
member.summary: The vertical component of the desired aspect ratio of the indicator.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.offset
member.summary: Offsets the indicator position up by this proportion of its height. 1.0 = 1 unit high offset.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.Effects.TouchJoystickRadialIndicator.rectTransform
member.summary: Gets the RectTransform attached to this GameObject.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton
member.summary: A touch button control.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.SetRawValue(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the raw value in the button's axis.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.SetDefaultPosition
member.summary: Record the current anchored position as the button's default position. The button will return to this position when released when using a Touch Region with moveToTouchPosition set to True. If you move the button's position and want it to return there next time, you should record the new default position by calling this method.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.SetDefaultAnchoredPosition(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the button's default position. The button will return to this position when released when using a Touch Region with moveToTouchPosition set to True. If you move the button's position and want it to return there next time, you should record the new default position by calling this method.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ReturnToDefaultPosition(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the button to the default position.
member.param: Snap to the position immediately, otherwise use movement animation settings.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ReturnToDefaultPosition
member.summary: Moves the button to the default position.

member.name: M:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.OnClear
member.summary: Clears the control completely including all internal states.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.AxisValueChangedEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the axis value changes.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonValueChangedEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the button value changes.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonDownEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the button is pressed.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonUpEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the button is released

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.targetCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from this control.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.buttonType
member.summary: The type of button.\nStandard = A momentary switch. Returns True while the button is pressed down.\nToggle Switch = Alternately turns on and off with each press.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.activateOnSwipeIn
member.summary: If true, the button can be turned on by a touch swipe that began in an area outside the button region. If false, the button can only be turned on by a direct press.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.stayActiveOnSwipeOut
member.summary: If true, the button will stay on even if the touch that activated it moves outside the button region. If false, the button will turn off once the touch that activated it moves outside the button region. If Follow Touch Position is True, this will always return True except in the case of using a Touch Region with Use Touch Region Only set to True also.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.useDigitalAxisSimulation
member.summary: Makes the axis value gradually change over time based on gravity and sensitivity as the button is pressed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.digitalAxisGravity
member.summary: Speed (units/sec) that the axis value falls toward 0 when not pressed. A value of 1.0 means an axis value of 1 will drain to 0 over 1 second. A value of 3 equates to 1/3 of a second, and so on.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.digitalAxisSensitivity
member.summary: Speed to move toward an axis value of 1.0 in units/sec when pressed. A value of 1.0 means an axis value of 0 will reach 1 over 1 second. A value of 3 equates to 1/3 of a second, and so on.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.touchRegion
member.summary: Optional external region to use for hover/click/touch detection. If set, this region will be used for touch detection instead of or in addition to the button's RectTransform. This can be useful if you want a larger area of the screen to act as a button.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.useTouchRegionOnly
member.summary: If True, hovers/clicks/touches on the local button will be ignored and only Touch Region touches will be used. Otherwise, both touches on the button and on the Touch Region will be used. This also applies to mouse hover. This setting has no effect if no Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.moveToTouchPosition
member.summary: If True, the button will move to the location of the current touch in the Touch Region. This can be used to designate an area of the screen as a hot-spot for a button and have the button graphics follow the users touches. This only has an effect if a Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.returnOnRelease
member.summary: If Move To Touch Position is enabled, this will make the button return to its original position after the press is released. This only has an effect if a Touch Region is set.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.followTouchPosition
member.summary: If True, the button will follow the touch around until released. This setting overrides Move To Touch Position.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.animateOnMoveToTouch
member.summary: Should the button animate when moving to the touch point? This only has an effect if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set. This setting is ignored if Follow Touch Position is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.moveToTouchSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the button will move toward the touch position measured in screens per second (based on the larger of width and height). [1.0 = Move 1 screen/sec]. This only has an effect if Move To Touch Position is True, Animate On Move To Touch is true, and a Touch Region is set. This setting is ignored if Follow Touch Position is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.animateOnReturn
member.summary: Should the button animate when moving back to its original position? This only has an effect if Follow Touch Position is True, or if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set, and Return on Release is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.returnSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the button will move back toward its original position measured in screens per second (based on the larger of width and height). [1.0 = Move 1 screen/sec]. This only has an effect if Follow Touch Position is True, or if Move To Touch Position is True and a Touch Region is set, and Return on Release and Animate on Return are both True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.manageRaycasting
member.summary: If True, it will attempt to automatically manage Graphic component raycasting for best results based on your current settings.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.pointerId
member.summary: The pointer id that currently has control of this button. If there is no pointer id, the value is TouchControl.POINTER_ID_NULL. Only one pointer id (touch, mouse, etc.) may be in control of this button at any time.

member.summary: Is this button currently being controlled by a touch or pointer?

member.summary: The internal axis of the button. The axis is used for all value calculations.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.axisValue
member.summary: The axis value of the button.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.axisValuePrev
member.summary: The previous axis value of the button. Note that this is previous value set, but not necessarily the value in the last frame.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.buttonValue
member.summary: The value of the button.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.buttonValuePrev
member.summary: The previous value of the button. Note that this is previous value set, but not necessarily the value in the last frame.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonType
member.summary: Button type

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonType.Standard
member.summary: A momentary switch. Returns True while the button is pressed down.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchButton.ButtonType.ToggleSwitch
member.summary: Alternately turns on and off with each press.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchController
member.summary: Responsible for managing touch controls and sending data to a Custom Controller. A Touch Controller component must exist as the parent of all touch controls.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchController.disableMouseInputWhenEnabled
member.summary: If true, disables mouse input when the Touch Controller script is enabled or GameObject is activated and re-enables mouse input when the script is disabled or GameObject is deactivated. This is useful for disabling Mouse Look controls when using touch controls in an FPS for example.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchController.useCustomController
member.summary: If true, a Custom Controller will be populated with the data from this controller.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad
member.summary: A touch pad control.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.ValueChangedEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the value changes.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.TapEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the touch pad is tapped. This event will only be sent if allowTap is True.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.PressDownEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the touch pad is initally pressed. This event is for the Press button simulation which must be enabled by setting Press Allowed to True. This event will only be sent if allowPress is True.

member.name: E:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.PressUpEvent
member.summary: Event sent when the touch pad is released after a press. This event is for the Press button simulation which must be enabled by setting Press Allowed to True. This event will only be sent if allowPress is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.horizontalAxisCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from the touch pad's X axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.verticalAxisCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from the touch pad's Y axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.tapCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from touch pad taps.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.pressCustomControllerElement
member.summary: The Custom Controller element that will receive input values from touch pad presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.axesToUse
member.summary: The axis directions in which movement is allowed. You can restrict movement to one or both axes.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.touchPadMode
member.summary: The mode of the touch pad.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.valueFormat
member.summary: The format of the resulting data generated by the touch pad.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.useInertia
member.summary: If enabled, when swiped and released, the value will slowly fall toward zero based on the Friction value. This only has an effect if touchPadMode is set to TouchPadMode.PositionDelta.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.inertiaFriction
member.summary: Determines how quickly a swipe value will fall toward zero when useInertia is True.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.activateOnSwipeIn
member.summary: If true, the touch pad can be activated by a touch swipe that began in an area outside the touch pad region. If false, the touch pad can only be activated by a direct touch.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.stayActiveOnSwipeOut
member.summary: If true, the touch pad will stay engaged even if the touch that activated it moves outside the touch pad region. If false, the touch pad will be released once the touch that activated it moves outside the touch pad region.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.allowTap
member.summary: Should taps on the touch pad be processed?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.tapTimeout
member.summary: The maximum touch duration allowed for the touch to be considered a tap.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.tapDistanceLimit
member.summary: The maximum movement distance allowed in pixels since the touch began for the touch to be considered a tap. [-1 = no limit]

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.allowPress
member.summary: Should presses (continual press like a button) on the touch pad be processed?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.pressStartDelay
member.summary: Time the touch pad must be touched before it will be considered a press.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.pressDistanceLimit
member.summary: The maximum movement distance allowed in pixels since the touch began for the touch to be considered a press. Any movement beyond this value will cancel the press. [-1 = no limit]

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.hideAtRuntime
member.summary: If enabled, the control will be hidden when gameplay starts.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.pointerId
member.summary: The pointer id that currently has control of this control. If there is no pointer id, the value is TouchControl.POINTER_ID_NULL. Only one pointer id (touch, mouse, etc.) may be in control of this button at any time.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.hasPointer
member.summary: Is this control currently being controlled by a touch or pointer?

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.axis2D
member.summary: The underlying 2D axis.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.TouchPadMode.Delta
member.summary: Returns the change in position of the touch from the previous to the current frame.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.TouchPadMode.ScreenPosition
member.summary: Returns the absolute position of the touch on the screen.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.TouchPadMode.VectorFromCenter
member.summary: Returns a vector from the center of the Touch Pad to the current touch position.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.TouchPadMode.VectorFromInitialTouch
member.summary: Returns a vector from the intial touch position to the current touch position.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.ValueFormat.Pixels
member.summary: Screen pixels.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.ValueFormat.Screen
member.summary: The proportion of the value to screen size in the corresponding dimension. 1 unit = 1 screen length (width for X, height for Y).

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.ValueFormat.Physical
member.summary: 1 unit = 1/100th of an inch. The resulting value will be consistent across different screen resolutions and sizes. IMPORTANT: This relies on the value returned by UnityEngine.Screen.dpi. If the device does not return a value, a reference resolution of 96 dpi will be used.

member.name: F:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchPad.ValueFormat.Direction
member.summary: A normalized direction vector.

member.name: T:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchRegion
member.summary: A Touch Region is a control which is used to activate another control remotely. This allows you to specify an area of the canvas to be used to activate the control.

member.name: P:Rewired.ComponentControls.TouchRegion.hideAtRuntime
member.summary: If enabled, the Touch Region will be hidden when gameplay starts.

member.name: T:Rewired.Controller
member.summary: The base class for all controllers.

member.name: F:Rewired.Controller.id
member.summary: Rewired unique id of this controller. This is not an index. The id is unique among controllers of a specific controller type.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonIndexById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of the Button with the specified element idenfitier id.
member.returns: The index of the Button with the specified element idenfitier id. Returns -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetElementIdentifierById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a Controller Element Identifier by id.
member.returns: Controller Element Identifier with the specified id. Returns null if none found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of the hardware button at the specified index. This will return TRUE as long as the button is held. This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the button just pressed state of the hardware button at the specified index. This will only return TRUE only on the first frame the button is pressed This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the button just released state of the hardware button at the specified index. This will only return TRUE only on the first frame the button is released This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonChanged(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the button has changed state from the previous frame to the current. This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonPrev(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the previous button held state of the hardware button at the specified index. This will return TRUE if the button was held in the previous frame. This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDoublePressHold(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the double press and hold state of the button at the specified index. This will return TRUE after the double press is detected and for as long as the button is held thereafter.
member.returns: Button double press and hold state

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDoublePressDown(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the double press down state of the button at the specified index. This will return TRUE only on the first frame the double press is detected.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDoublePressHold(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the double press and hold state of the button at the specified index. This will return TRUE after the double press is detected and for as long as the button is held thereafter. This will use the default double press speed.
member.returns: Button double press and hold state

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDoublePressDown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the double press down state of the button at the specified index. This will return TRUE only on the first frame the double press is detected. This will use the default double press speed.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonTimePressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the length of time the button at index has been active.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonTimeUnpressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the length of time the button at index has been inactive.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonLastTimePressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the last timestamp the button at index was active.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonLastTimeUnpressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the last timestamp the button at index was inactive.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetAnyButtonDown

Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.summary: Gets the double press and hold state of the button at the specified element identifier id. This will return TRUE after the double press is detected and for as long as the button is held thereafter. This will use the default double press speed.
member.returns: Button double press and hold state

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonDoublePressDownById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the double press down state of the button at the specified element identifier id. This will return TRUE only on the first frame the double press is detected. This will use the default double press speed.

member.name: M:Rewired.Controller.GetButtonPrevById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the previous button held state of the hardware button at the specified element identifier id. This will return TRUE if the button was held in the previous frame. This does not take into acount any controller mapping or Actions -- this is the unmapped physical button value only. Use the Player class to get button values mapped to Actions.

member.name: T:Rewired.Controller.CompoundElement
member.summary: Base class for compound elements. Compound elements are a combination of existing elements such as 2 axes making up an Axis 2D. Compound elements have no value in and of themselves, but combine values from their member elements to produce a result. Compound elements cannot be mapped with an ActionElementMap. Instead, the component axes are each mapped individually.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.CompoundElement.name
member.summary: The name of this element.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.CompoundElement.type
member.summary: The type of this element.

member.summary: Does this compound element have any member elements?

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.CompoundElement.elementCount
member.summary: The number of member elements in this compound element.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.CompoundElement.elementCapacity
member.summary: The maximum capacity of memober elements in this compound element.

member.name: T:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D
member.summary: Axis 2D is a combination of values from two individual Axes. This is primarily used for analog sticks. A radial deadzone is applied to the combined values. The deazone is the larger of the two deadzones set in the individual axes. Axis 2D cannot be mapped with an ActionElementMap. Instead, the component axes are each mapped individually. When two Axes are combined into an Axis2D, the values of the individual Axes are changed to reflect the radial deadzone applied by the parent Axis2D.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.elementCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of member Axes of Axis2D.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.xAxis
member.summary: The X Axis element.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.yAxis
member.summary: The Y Axis element.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.value
member.summary: The combined current value of the X and Y axes.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.valuePrev
member.summary: The combined value of the X and Y axes from the previous frame.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.valueRaw
member.summary: The combined current raw value of the X and Y axes.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Axis2D.valueRawPrev
member.summary: The combined raw value of the X and Y axes from the previous frame.

member.name: T:Rewired.Controller.Hat
member.summary: A hat is a compound element made up of 4 or 8 individual buttons. If this is a 4-way hat, only up, down, right, and left are supported. Corner presses will activate the two cardinal directions. If this is an 8-way hat, all 8 directions are supported. Corner presses will activate the corner buttons.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.elementCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of member Buttons of the Hat.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.force4Way
member.summary: Force this hat to behave as a 4-way hat. This only has any effect if the hat is an 8-way hat. If enabled, the corner directions will activate the adjacent 2 cardinal direction buttons instead of the corner button. This is useful if you need the hat to behave like a D-Pad instead of an 8-way hat. If the global ReInput.configuration.force4WayHats is enabled, setting this to false will have no effect as the global flag overrides this value.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.directionCount
member.summary: The number of directions supported by this hat. This can be 4, 8, or 0.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.Buttons
member.summary: Gets the list of member buttons. There is one entry for each possible direction button in this hat. Check directionCount to determine whether this is a 4 or 8-way hat. Entries may be null if no button is assigned to a direction. The order of the buttons starts at up and rotates clockwise.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.buttonUp
member.summary: The button for the up direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.name: P:Rewired.Controller.Hat.buttonRight
member.summary: The button for the right direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the down direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the left direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the up-right direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the down-right direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the down-left direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.summary: The button for the up-left direction. This value may be null if no button is assigned.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetAccelerometerValueRaw
member.summary: Gets the raw value from the accelerometer as reported by the device. Reported device coordinates do not match Unity's coordinate system. Format: 1G = 8192f This value represents the last value reported by the accelerometer.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetAccelerometerValue
member.summary: Gets the value from the accelerometer and processes it so that 1G = 1.0 and so that coordinates match Unity coordinate system. The value returned could be thought of as a gravity vector and user acceleration combined. If using this value to apply a force in the direction of the vector, invert each axis first. This value represents the last value reported by the accelerometer.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetLastGyroscopeValueRaw
member.summary: Gets the last raw value from the gyroscope as reported by the device. Reported device coordinates do not match Unity's coordinate system. The sensor can return more than one value per frame. This represents only the last measurement recorded, not an accumulated value. This value is not fused with the accelerometer value and can drift.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetLastGyroscopeValue
member.summary: Gets the last value from the gyroscope processed into Unity's coordinate system and adjusted for sensitivity. The sensor can return more than one value per frame. This represents only the last measurement recorded, not an accumulated value. This value is not fused with the accelerometer value and can drift.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetGyroscopeValueRaw
member.summary: Gets the raw value from the gyroscope as reported by the device accumulated over time since the last update. Reported device coordinates do not match Unity's coordinate system. This value is not fused with the accelerometer value and can drift.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetGyroscopeValue
member.summary: Gets the value from the gyroscope processed into Unity's coordinate system, adjusted for sensitivity, and accumulated over time since the last update. This value is not fused with the accelerometer value and can drift.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetOrientation
member.summary: Gets the orientation of the controller in Unity coordinates. This is only an estimate because accelerometer + gyroscope is not accurate enough to perfectly determine orientation at all angles. Drift can occur on the world Y axis over time. The orientation can be reset by calling ResetOrientation(). Note: Orientation is not very reliable when connected via Bluetooth due to the possibility of dropped gyro data.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.ResetOrientation
member.summary: Resets the orientation to zero state. (Controller laying on back with buttons facing up and the top edge of the controller facing the screen.)

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetTouchId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the touch id for the touch at the specified index.
member.returns: Touch id. Returns -1 if there is no current touch at the specified index.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetTouchPosition(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Gets the touch position for a particular index normalized to a 0 - 1 range. (Left = 0, Bottom = 0)
member.param: The index of the touch for which to return position.
member.returns: True if the touch at index is currently touching. False if there is no touch at index.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetTouchPositionByTouchId(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Gets the touch position for a particular touch id normalized to a 0 - 1 range. (Left = 0, Bottom = 0)
member.param: The id of the touch for which to return position.
member.returns: True if the touch at touchId is currently touching. False if there is no touch at touchId.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetTouchPositionAbsolute(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Gets the touch position for a particular index in absolute units as returned by the device. (Left = 0, Bottom = 0)
member.param: The index of the touch for which to return position.
X/Y position of the touch in absolute units.
member.returns: True if the touch at index is currently touching. False if there is no touch at index.

member.name: M:Rewired.ControllerExtensions.DualShock4Extension.GetTouchPositionAbsoluteByTouchId(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Gets the touch position for a particular touch id in absolute units as returned by the device. (Left = 0, Bottom = 0)
member.param: The id of the touch for which to return position.
X/Y position of the touch in absolute units.
member.returns: True if the touch at touchId is currently touching. False if there is no touch at touchId.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.joystickTypes
member.summary: The joystick types that apply to this Joystick. A Joystick may have more than one Joystick Type.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.systemId
member.summary: The id of the device in the underlying input source. The meaning of this value is determined by the current input source. This may include Unity input, Raw Input, Direct Input, OSX I/O Kit, XBoxOneInput, Ouya input, and others. Generally, you should never need to use this, but it is exposed for advanced uses. Returns null if there is no system id associated with this joystick.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.unityId
member.summary: The unity joystick id of this joystick. This value is only used on platforms that use Unity input as the underlying input source. This value is a 1-based index corresponding to the joystick number in the Unity input manager. Generally, you should never need to use this, but it is exposed for advanced uses. Returns 0 if the platform does not use Unity input or if the joystick is not associated with a Unity joystick.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.hardwareTypeGuid
member.summary: The Rewired GUID associated with this device. A GUID of all zeros is an Unknown Controller.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.deviceInstanceGuid
member.summary: The unique persistent instance GUID of this device. This is an id generated for the device that may stay constant between application sessions and system restarts. This can be used for device assignment persistence between runs. The specific platform and input sources in use affects the reliability of this value for device assignment persistence. A value of Guid.Empty means the device or input source has no reliable unique identifier so persistant assignment isn't possible using this value. Even if a Guid is provided, reliability when multiple identical controllers are attached depends greatly on the platform and input source(s) currently in use.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.supportsVibration
member.summary: Does this controller support vibration?

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.vibrationLeftMotor
member.summary: Sets vibration speed on the left motor or the motor at index 0. [float: 0.0 - 1.0] This is specifically for XInput controllers on Windows.

member.name: P:Rewired.Joystick.vibrationRightMotor
member.summary: Sets vibration speed on the right motor or the motor at index 1. [float: 0.0 - 1.0] This is specifically for XInput controllers on Windows.

member.name: M:Rewired.Data.UserData.FindJoystickMap_Game(Rewired.Joystick,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the user-defined maps for a matching map based on category, layout, controller Guid, and template Guid. First it will search for an exact controller guid + category + layout match. If no controller guid's match, it search for a template map. Failing that, it will search for a generic map. If no map is found, a blank map will be loaded.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventType.ButtonJustShortPressed

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventType.ButtonLongPressed

member.name: F:Rewired.InputActionEventType.ButtonJustLongPressed

members.member:
Decompose the rotation on to 2 parts. 1. Twist - rotation around the "direction" vector 2. Swing - rotation around axis that is perpendicular to "direction" vector The rotation can be composed back by rotation = swing * twist
has singularity in case of swing_rotation close to 180 degrees rotation. if the input quaternion is of non-unit length, the outputs are non-unit as well otherwise, outputs are both unit

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ExpandableArray_DataContainer`1
member.summary: An expandable array which uses objects to hold data. Creates an object for every entry. These objects remain even when Clear is called, but the contents are cleared. Data is added by padding another instance of T object from which the contents are copied to the public object. The passed object itself is not added, but objects contained in the passer object are stored by reference (not cloned). You cannot add objects to the list directly, only data witin the object. Your T must implement the Workpool_DataContainer<T>.IEntry interface.

member.name: T:Rewired.VirtualButton
member.summary: A virtual button that is used to track button states for things like keyboard + modifier keys and mouse axes being treated as digital buttons. This is auto-cleared every update by Control Manager. You cannot set the button value to false, only true. It can be set multiple times per frame as well without issue.

member.name: M:Rewired.VirtualButton.SetOn(Rewired.UpdateLoopType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This does not store the valuePrev at this time so it can be set multiple times per update. You cannot set a negative value here because the button may be fed by multiple sources and negatives cannot cancel out positives. The button value will be cleared at the end up update.

member.name: M:Rewired.VirtualButton.InnerButton.SetOn(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This does not store the valuePrev at this time so it can be set multiple times per update. You cannot set a negative value here because the button may be fed by multiple sources and negatives cannot cancel out positives. The button value will be cleared at the end up update.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the Axis. A disabled Axis always returns a value of 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the dead zone. If the Axis's absolute value is less than or equal to the dead zone, it will return 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the zero value. This can be used to correct a non-zero resting state.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.calibratedMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value. This can be used to transform the value to a new range.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.calibratedMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value. This can be used to transform the value to a new range.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.invert
member.summary: If true, the final value will be multiplied by -1. This can be used to correct an inverted Axis.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.sensitivityType
member.summary: Determines how sensitivity will be calculated. If sensitivityType is set to Multiplier or Power, the sensitivity property is used to calculate the value. If sensitivityType is set to Curve, the sensitivityCurve property is used to calculate the value.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensitivity value.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.sensitivityCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensitivity curve. The curve has no effect unless sensitivityType is set to Curve.

member.name: P:Rewired.AxisCalibration.applyRangeCalibration
member.summary: If enabled, calibratedMin, calibratedMax, and calibratedZero will be used to convert the value to a new range. If disabled, calibratedMin, calibratedMax, and calibratedZero will have no effect on the final value.

member.summary: Creates an ActionElementMap in this controller map for a controller button or axis assignment.
member.param: The id of the Action to bind to.
When the button or split-axis is activated, does it return a positive or negative value?
The id of the controller element identifier the Action will be bound to.
The type of controller element the Action will be bound to.
The portion of the axis the Action will be bound to. (Only used if elementType is Axis.)
Is the axis inverted? (Only used if elementType is Axis and axisRange is Full.)
