member.summary: Imports data from an InputBehavior. Note: Does not copy id.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputBehavior.Clone
member.summary: Copies this object.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputBehavior.Reset
member.summary: Restores all settings to originals from the Rewired Input Manager.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.id
member.summary: The id of this Input Behavior.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.name
member.summary: The name of this Input Behavior.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.joystickAxisSensitivity
member.summary: All joystick axes are multiplied by this value.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.digitalAxisSimulation
member.summary: Enables digital axis simulation which makes button or key presses contribute to an Action's axis value gradually over time based on gravity and sensitivity. This only affects axis values generated by button and key presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.digitalAxisSnap
member.summary: When input is received in the opposite direction of the current flow, snap axis value to 0 and continue from there. This only affects axis values generated by button and key presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.digitalAxisInstantReverse
member.summary: When input is received in the opposite direction of the current flow, reverse the current value to the opposite sign and continue from there. This only affects axis values generated by button and key presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.digitalAxisGravity
member.summary: Speed (units/sec) that the axis value falls toward 0. This only affects axis values generated by button and key presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.digitalAxisSensitivity
member.summary: Speed to move toward an axis value of 1.0 in units/sec. This only affects axis values generated by button and key presses.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.mouseXYAxisMode
member.summary: Affects how mouse X/Y axes contribute to the value. Mouse Axis - Value range that depends on speed of movement. The value can and does exceed +/- 1.0 by a large amount. This value is the same value returned by Unity's Input.GetAxis when axis type is set to Mouse Movement. Mouse Sensitivity is multiplied by the axis value. Digital Axis - Any mouse movement returns a value from -1.0 to 1.0 and is smoothed by the digital axis filters. This makes mouse movement behave like a button or key press. ScreenPositionDelta - A value from -1.0 to 1.0 that represents the distance moved across the screen over the update cycle. The value is normalized based on the width and height of the screen. A movement across the entire screen distance in one update cycle will return +/- 1.0. Speed - A value based on the speed the mouse is moved across the screen. Speed is calculated from the mouse movement delta / delta time. The returned value can exceed +/- 1.0.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.mouseOtherAxisMode
member.summary: Affects how mouse axes other than X/Y contribute to the value. This affects the mouse wheel axis. Mouse Axis - Value range goes beyond -1 to 1 depending on speed of movement. This value is the same value returned by Unity's Input.GetAxis when axis type is set to Mouse Movement. Mouse Other Axis Sensitivity is multiplied by the axis value. Digital Axis - Any movement returns -1 to 1 and is smoothed by digital axes values. Mouse movement behaves like a button or keyboard key press. Mouse sensitivity does not affect this mode. Instead, all Digital Axis filters are applied.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.mouseXYAxisSensitivity
member.summary: Mouse X/Y axes are multiplied by this value.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.mouseXYAxisDeltaCalc
member.summary: Determines how the screen position delta (and therefore speed) is calculated for mouse X/Y axes. An equvalent mouse movement on X and Y will yield a different result for delta X and delta Y if the screen width and height are not equal. If you need the delta consistent between X and Y movement, change this to ScreenWidth or ScreenHeight and the delta will be calculated based on only one dimension. Note that the returned value may exceed +/- 1.0 if set to a value other than Normal.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.mouseOtherAxisSensitivity
member.summary: All mouse axes except X/Y are multiplied by this value.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.customControllerAxisSensitivity
member.summary: All Custom Controller axes are multiplied by this value.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonDoublePressSpeed
member.summary: Time in seconds in which to register a button double-press or double-click.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonShortPressTime
member.summary: Time in seconds that a button or axis must be held to register a short press.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonShortPressExpiresIn
member.summary: Time in seconds after a short press is registered after which it will expire and no longer return true for any button events. For example: If you want the press to expire 2 seconds after the press first registers true, set this value to 2. This is useful, for example, if you want short and long presses to be mutually exclusive. [0 = Never expires]

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonLongPressTime
member.summary: Time in seconds that a button or axis must be held to register a long press.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonLongPressExpiresIn
member.summary: Time in seconds after a long press is registered after which it will expire and no longer return true for any button events. For example: If you want the press to expire 2 seconds after the press first registers true, set this value to 2. [0 = Never expires]

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonDeadZone
member.summary: When an Action's axis value is below this threshold, GetButton will return false. This is useful if you map axes as buttons. If the value is too low, GetButton may always return true. If the value is 1, it will never return true.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonDownBuffer
member.summary: Time in seconds to buffer GetButtonDown results. This makes GetButtonDown return TRUE for extra time beyond a single frame. This is useful to prevent missing button presses when pressing very rapidly and the game ignores these presses due to some blocking action. Ex: Punching in rapid succession, but presses are ignored during the punch animation. The buffer value should generally be very small such as 0.08 s, but this will depend on your specific needs.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonRepeatRate
member.summary: The number of times per second the button state will be True when queried with GetButtonRepeating or the equivalent event.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputBehavior.buttonRepeatDelay
member.summary: The duration in seconds before repeating will begin after the initial press when queried with GetButtonRepeating or the equivalent event. [0 = No delay]

member.name: T:Rewired.InputMapper
member.summary: A class that simplifies the process of remapping controls. Handles listening for controller input, conflict checking, and creating Action-element assignments.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputMapper.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new InputMapper.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputMapper.RemoveEventListeners(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the event listener(s) from all events. You can pass the object that contains the target delegates to unsubscribe all delegates in that object from all events. For example, if your class MyClass subscribes to several events, you can pass the MyClass object into this method to remove all of its listeners. Example: mapper.RemoveEventListeners(this);
member.param: The event listener to remove from all events. This can be either the containing class object or the delegate.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputMapper.RemoveAllEventListeners
member.summary: Removes all event listeners from all events.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputMapper.RemoveCallbacks(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the delegate(s) from all callbacks. You can pass the object that contains the target delegates to remove all delegates in that object from all callbacks. For example, if your class MyClass supplies several delegates for callbacks, you can pass the MyClass object into this method to remove all of its delegates. Example: mapper.RemoveCallbacksListeners(this);
member.param: The delegate to remove from all callbacks. This can be either the containing class object or the delegate.

member.name: M:Rewired.InputMapper.RemoveAllCallbacks
member.summary: Removes all callbacks from all events.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Context.actionId
member.summary: The id of the Action to be mapped. This is a required field. This can also be set using the actionName field instead.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Context.actionName
member.summary: The name of the Action to be mapped. This is just a convenience property to allow you to set the actionId property by using the string name instead of the id. Setting this property will set the actionId property with the corresponding id.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Context.controllerMap
member.summary: The Controller Map that will be populated with the new mapping. This is a required field.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Context.actionElementMapToReplace
member.summary: The ActionElementMap to be replaced. This ActionElementMap must exist in the Controller Map being passed in or you will get an error. Leave null if you are not replacing an existing mapping.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Context.actionRange
member.summary: The range of the Action's value to map input to. For example, for an axis-type Action, should user input be mapped to the full range of the Action or just one side of the Action (+/-)?

member.name: T:Rewired.InputMapper.ConflictResponse
member.summary: Actions to take when a conflict is found.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputMapper.ConflictResponse.Cancel
member.summary: The assignment will be canceled.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputMapper.ConflictResponse.Replace
member.summary: The conflicting mappings will be cleared and the new assignment added.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputMapper.ConflictResponse.Add
member.summary: The conflicting mappings will be left as-is and the new assignment will be added.

member.name: F:Rewired.InputMapper.ConflictResponse.Ignore
member.summary: The conflict will be ignored and polling will continue.

member.summary: Should axes be polled for user input?

member.summary: Should buttons be polled for user input?

member.summary: Should assignment conflict checking be enabled?

member.summary: Should assignment conflicts be checked with all Players? This setting overrides all other checkForConflictsWith options.

member.summary: Should assignment conflicts be checked with the current Player?

member.summary: Should assignment conflicts be checked with the System Player?

member.summary: A list of Player Ids to check for assignment conflicts with.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.defaultActionWhenConflictFound
member.summary: When an assignment conflict is found, if there is no event listener for the ConflictsFoundEvent, the default action defined here will be used to resolve the conflict.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.ignoreMouseXAxis
member.summary: Should the the mouse X axis be ignored when polling for user input?

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.ignoreMouseYAxis
member.summary: Should the the mouse Y axis be ignored when polling for user input?

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.allowKeyboardKeysWithModifiers
member.summary: Should modifier key + key combinations be allowed for keyboard mappings? Otherwise, only individual key mappings will be allowed.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.allowKeyboardModifierKeyAsPrimary
member.summary: Should keyboard modifier keys be allowed as the primary key for the Action?

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.holdDurationToMapKeyboardModifierKeyAsPrimary
member.summary: If both allowKeyboardKeysWithModifiers and allowKeyboardModifierKeyAsPrimary are true, the modifier key must be held down for this duration in seconds before it will be accepted as a primary key assignment. This is used to allow the user to be able to map modifier key + key combinations while also allowing them to map modifier keys as the primary key.

member.name: P:Rewired.InputMapper.Options.isElementAllowedCallback
member.summary: A callback used to determine whether a particular controller element is allowed for mapping. Set this if you want to manually disallow specific controller elements from being used.

member.name: T:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Windows Standalone input sources.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource.RawInput
member.summary: Use Raw Input for the input source. Note: Raw Input carries significant advantages over Direct Input such as better Bluetooth controller support, support for more elements on certain controllers, better controller recognition, etc. Does not require any extra libraries. Windows Control Panel joystick calibration does not affect Joystick axes.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource.DirectInput
member.summary: Use Direct Input for the input source. Installation of DirectX end-user runtimes may be required for Direct Input support. Windows Control Panel joystick calibration settings affect Joystick axes.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource.XInput
member.summary: Use XInput for the input source. This will use XInput only. All non-XInput compatible controllers will be non-functional. To support both XInput and non-XInput controllers, use Raw Input or Direct Input instead and enable the Use XInput option. Installation of DirectX end-user runtimes is required on Windows XP.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource.SDL2
member.summary: Use SDL2 for the input source. This option requires the SDL2 runtime library to be installed. Note: SDL2 does not support as many devices as other native input sources.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.WindowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource.Unity
member.summary: Use Unity fallback input.

member.name: T:Rewired.Platforms.OSXStandalonePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: OSX Standalone input sources.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.OSXStandalonePrimaryInputSource.Native
member.summary: Use native input for the input source. This provides the best device support.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.OSXStandalonePrimaryInputSource.SDL2
member.summary: SDL2 - Use SDL2 for the input source. May be required for Steam Streaming and Steam Controller support in OSX. This option requires the SDL2 runtime library to be installed. Note: SDL2 does not support as many devices as other native input sources.

member.name: F:Rewired.Platforms.OSXStandalonePrimaryInputSource.Unity
member.summary: Unity Input - Use Unity fallback input.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.GetButtonTimedPress(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.GetButtonTimedPress(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time the button must be held before returning true.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.GetButtonTimedPress(System.String,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.
member.param: Minimum time in seconds the button must be held before returning true.
Time in seconds after activation that the press will expire. Once expired, it will no longer return true even if held. [0 = Never expire]

member.summary: Gets the button held state of an Action after being held for a period of time. This will return TRUE only after the button has been held for the specified time and will continue to return TRUE until the button is released. This also applies to axes being used as buttons.

member.name: P:Rewired.Player.isPlaying
member.summary: Is this Player currently playing? This property is for user use. It is never set to anything but whatever you set in the Rewired Input Manager Player's page for the "Is Playing on Start" field. The only thing that Player.isPlaying affects internally is Joystick Auto-Assignment if "Assign to Playing Players Only" is set to True. One might use Player.isPlaying to flag that a Player has joined in and is active or has quit/lost all their lives, etc. Player.isPlaying does not affect input returned by the Player.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ConflictCheckingHelper.DoesElementAssignmentConflict(Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerMap)

The Controller Map whose Action Element Maps will be checked against for conflicts.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ConflictCheckingHelper.DoesElementAssignmentConflict(Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerMap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if any element assignments on a particular Controller assigned to this Player conflicts with any of the assignments on the incoming Controller Map.
member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.
The Controller Map whose Action Element Maps will be checked against for conflicts.
If true, disabled Controller Maps and Action Element Maps will be skipped.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ConflictCheckingHelper.DoesElementAssignmentConflict(Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerMap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if any element assignments on a particular Controller assigned to this Player conflicts with any of the assignments on the incoming Controller Map.
member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.
The Controller Map whose Action Element Maps will be checked against for conflicts.
If true, disabled Controller Maps and Action Element Maps will be skipped.
If true, all Map Categories will be checked against each other for conflicts regardless of the Map Category to Map Category conflict checking settings defined in the Rewired Input Manager.

member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.
The Controller Map that contains the incoming Action Element Map. This is used to determine the Map Category for Map Category to Map Category conflict checking.
The Action Element Map whose assignment will be checked against for conflicts.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ConflictCheckingHelper.ElementAssignmentConflicts(Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerMap,Rewired.ActionElementMap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates all conflicts between element assignments on a particular Controller assigned to this Player and the assignment in the incoming Action Element Map.
member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.
The Controller Map that contains the incoming Action Element Map. This is used to determine the Map Category for Map Category to Map Category conflict checking.
The Action Element Map whose assignment will be checked against for conflicts.
If true, disabled Controller Maps and Action Element Maps will be skipped.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ConflictCheckingHelper.ElementAssignmentConflicts(Rewired.ControllerType,System.Int32,Rewired.ControllerMap,Rewired.ActionElementMap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates all conflicts between element assignments on a particular Controller assigned to this Player and the assignment in the incoming Action Element Map.
member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.
The Controller Map that contains the incoming Action Element Map. This is used to determine the Map Category for Map Category to Map Category conflict checking.
The Action Element Map whose assignment will be checked against for conflicts.
If true, disabled Controller Maps and Action Element Maps will be skipped.
If true, all Map Categories will be checked against each other for conflicts regardless of the Map Category to Map Category conflict checking settings defined in the Rewired Input Manager.

member.name: T:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.ControllerSetCollection
member.summary: It's just small wrapper around an array so it's fast. Wouldn't be fast for large collections because it doesn't use buckets and hash like a dict and has to linearly search the array, but this will never be large. Tests show it about 40% faster than a Dictionary of the same length with the same values.

member.name: T:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.MapHelper
member.summary: Provides access to all mapping related members.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.MapHelper.LoadMap``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads a controller map from the maps defined in the Rewired Editor. Replaces if a map already exists with the same category and layout. When replaced, map enabled state is copied from the existing map into the replacement. Otherwise, map starts disabled and must be enabled before it can contribute to input.
member.param: Controller id - Get this from the Controller.id property. For Keyboard and Mouse, just use 0.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.MapHelper.SetAllMapsEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the enabled state in all controller maps. NOTE: This method is not a persistent flag in Player that will set controller maps enabled/disabled upon loading. It is simply a shortcut for the iterating the controller maps currently loaded in the Player and set them enabled/disabled at the time the method is called. When new Controller Maps are loaded in the Player, either manually or when a Joystick is assigned, the newly loaded maps will be enabled/disabled based on the default enabled state settings for these maps on the Player page in the Rewired Input Manager, not based on previous calls to SetMapsEnabled. Read the documentation on Controller Maps for more information.
member.returns: Number of maps that changed state.

NOTE: This method is not a persistent flag in Player that will set controller maps enabled/disabled upon loading. It is simply a shortcut for the iterating the controller maps currently loaded in the Player and set them enabled/disabled at the time the method is called. When new Controller Maps are loaded in the Player, either manually or when a Joystick is assigned, the newly loaded maps will be enabled/disabled based on the default enabled state settings for these maps on the Player page in the Rewired Input Manager, not based on previous calls to SetMapsEnabled. Read the documentation on Controller Maps for more information.
member.returns: Number of maps that changed state.

member.name: M:Rewired.Player.ControllerHelper.MapHelper.SetMapsEnabled(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the enabled state in all controller maps in a particular category and layout. NOTE: This method is not a persistent flag in Player that will set a certain category of map enabled/disabled upon loading. It is simply a shortcut for the iterating the controller maps currently loaded in the Player and set them enabled/disabled at the time the method is called. When new Controller Maps are loaded in the Player, either manually or when a Joystick is assigned, the newly loaded maps will be enabled/disabled based on the default enabled state settings for these maps on the Player page in the Rewired Input Manager, not based on previous calls to SetMapsEnabled. Read the documentation on Controller Maps for more information.
member.returns: Number of maps that changed state.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.Reset
member.summary: Completely clears and reinitializes the Input Manager. This is equivalent to destroying the Rewired Input Manager and reinstantiating it. The current input configuration (Joystick ids, controller assignments, modified Controller Maps) will be reset. All stored references to Rewired objects (Player, Joystick, ReInput.ControllerHelper, etc.) will become invalid. All event listeners will be cleared.

member.summary: Frame count for current loop.

member.summary: Previous frame count for current loop.

member.name: F:Rewired.ReInput.absFrame
member.summary: Total frame count of all update loops combined. Valid value starts at 1, not 0.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.EarlyUpdate
member.summary: This runs every once every main Unity thread update at the beginning of FixedUpdate or Update, whichever runs first.

member.name: E:Rewired.ReInput.EarlyUpdateEvent
member.summary: This fires every once every main Unity thread update at the beginning of FixedUpdate or Update, whichever runs first. This event always executes on the main thread.

member.summary: This event fires every update loop before Rewired's core update.

member.summary: Provides access to time-related data. This is mostly for accurate unscaled time comparisons for button and axis times.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.useXInput
member.summary: Toggles the use of XInput in Windows Standalone and Windows UWP during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.updateLoop
member.summary: Changes the Update Loop setting during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed. This can be set to multiple values simultaneously. Note: Update is required. Update will be enabled even if you unset the Update flag.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.windowsStandalonePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in Windows Standalone during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.osxStandalonePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in OSX Standalone during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.linuxStandalonePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in Linux Standalone during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.windowsUWPPrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in Windows 10 Universal during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.windowsUWPSupportHIDDevices
member.summary: Toggles support for HID devices in Windows UWP. This includes older gamepads, gamepads made for Android, flight controllers, racing wheels, etc. In order to use this feature, you must add support for HID gamepads and joysticks to the app manifest file. Please see the Special Platform Support -> Windows 10 Universal documentation for details. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.xboxOnePrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in Xbox One during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.ps4PrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in PS4 during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.webGLPrimaryInputSource
member.summary: Changes the primary input source in WebGL during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.alwaysUseUnityInput
member.summary: Toggles the use of Unity input during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed. This is an alias for disableNativeInput.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.disableNativeInput
member.summary: Toggles the use of Unity input during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.nativeMouseSupport
member.summary: Toggles the use of native mouse handling during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.nativeKeyboardSupport
member.summary: Toggles the use of native keyboard handling during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.enhancedDeviceSupport
member.summary: Toggles the use of enhanced device support during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.joystickRefreshRate
member.summary: The joystick refresh rate in frames per second. [0 - 2000] [0 = Default] Set this to a higher value if you need higher precision input timing at high frame rates such as for a music beat game. Higher values result in higher CPU usage. Note that setting this to a very high value when the game is running at a low frame rate will not result in higher precision input. This settings only applies to input sources that use a separate thread to poll for joystick input values (currently XInput and Direct Input). This setting does not apply to event-based input sources such as Raw Input. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.ignoreInputWhenAppNotInFocus
member.summary: Ignores input if the application is not in focus This setting has no effect on some platforms. NOTE: Disabling this does not guarantee that input will be processed when the application is out of focus. Whether input is received by the application or not is dependent on A) the input device type B) the current platform C) the input source(s) being used. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.android_supportUnknownGamepads
member.summary: Toggles the support of unknown gamepads on the Android platform during runtime. Rewired will be completely reset if this value is changed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.defaultJoystickAxis2DDeadZoneType
member.summary: Changes the default dead zone type for 2D joystick axes for recognized controllers. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.force4WayHats
member.summary: Force all 8-way hats on recognized joysticks to be treated as 4-way hats. If enabled, the corner directions on all hats will activate the adjacent 2 cardinal direction buttons instead of the corner button. This is useful if you need joystick hats to behave like D-Pads instead of 8-way hats. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.deferControllerConnectedEventsOnStart
member.summary: Defer controller connected events for controllers already connected when Rewired initializes until the Start event instead of during initialization. Normally, it's impossible to receive controller connection events at the start of runtime because Rewired initializes before any other script is able to subscribe to the controller connected event. Enabling this will defer the controller connected events until the Start event, allowing your scripts to subscribe to the controller connected event in Awake and still receive the event callback. If disabled, controller connection events for controllers already connected before runtime starts will be missed.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.autoAssignJoysticks
member.summary: Toggles joystick auto-assignment during runtime. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.maxJoysticksPerPlayer
member.summary: Set the max number of joysticks assigned to each Player by joystick auto-assignment during runtime. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.distributeJoysticksEvenly
member.summary: Toggles even joystick auto-assignment distribution among Players during runtime. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.assignJoysticksToPlayingPlayersOnly
member.summary: Toggles even joystick auto-assignment to Players with isPlayer = True only during runtime. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ConfigHelper.reassignJoystickToPreviousOwnerOnReconnect
member.summary: Toggles joystick auto-reassignment when re-connected to the last owning Player during runtime. This setting can be changed without resetting Rewired.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.GetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonPress
member.summary: Returns the 0 based id of the Unity joystick whose button was pressed. -1 if no button was pressed on any joystick. Use this to identify joysticks when using Unity's input system. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.returns: 0-based index of the Unity joystick whose button was pressed

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.GetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonOrAxisPress(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the 0 based id of the Unity joystick whose button or axis was pressed. -1 if no button or axis was pressed on any joystick. Use this to identify joysticks when using Unity's input system. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.returns: 0-based index of the Unity joystick whose button or axis was pressed
member.param: Any axis value below this threshold will be ignored.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickId(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. Use this to remap a joystick to its source when reconnected on platforms that use Unity Input. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.param: The id of the Joystick whose input source you are remapping.
The 0 based index of the Unity joystick which will become the Joystick's new input source.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonPress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. The first Unity joystick that returns a button press will be assigned to the Joystick. While no buttons are pressed, this will return False. When a button press is detected, it will return True and assign the joystick id.
member.returns: True if a joystick button was pressed and a joystick id was assigned.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonOrAxisPress(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. The first Unity joystick that returns a button or axis press will be assigned to the Joystick. While no buttons or axes are pressed, this will return False. When a press is detected, it will return True and assign the joystick id.
member.returns: True if a joystick button was pressed and a joystick id was assigned.
member.param: Any axis value below this threshold will be ignored.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.keyboardEnabled
member.summary: Enabled or disables keyboard input processing. Disabling keyboard input can improve performance on mobile devices. Also useful for joystick games on Android where certain joystick buttons return keyboard keycodes. Disabling keyboard input on Android will still allow certain keyboard keys to return values if triggered by a button press on a joystick, but no keyboard maps will ever be processed.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.MappingHelper.GetFirstJoystickTemplateElementIdentifier(Rewired.Joystick,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the first template Element Identifier on the first joystick template found that maps to the joystick's Element Identifier. NOTE: It is discouraged to use this method as the mapping template system wasn't designed for this use. This method has been added as a short-term solution to the problem of trying to identify controller elements as generic Gamepad elements for use in displaying visual help to users. A better solution will be available in the future and this method will be deprecated at that time.

member.param: The joystick hardware Guid identifier. Get from Joystick.hardwareTypeGuid.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.TimeHelper.unscaledDeltaTime
member.summary: Unscaled time since the last update in the current update loop. Always use this when doing current time comparisons for button and axis active/inactive times instead of Time.time or Time.unscaledTime.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.TimeHelper.unscaledTime
member.summary: Current unscaled time since start of the game. Always use this when doing current time comparisons for button and axis active/inactive times instead of Time.time or Time.unscaledTime.

member.name: P:Rewired.ReInput.TimeHelper.currentFrame
member.summary: The current frame in the current update loop. This value does not match UnityEngine.Time.frameCount.

member.name: T:Rewired.ReInput.UnityVariableWatcher
member.summary: Allows accessing Unity variables from another thread. Values are retrieved on Update and made available. Also provides a way to detect when a value changes.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.UnityVariableWatcher.Update
member.summary: Called in the first of either Update or FixedUpdate every thread frame.

members.member: Events ::SDL_USEREVENT through ::SDL_LASTEVENT are for your use, and should be allocated with SDL_RegisterEvents()
This last event is only for bounding internal arrays
\brief Joystick hat position change event structure (event.jhat.*)
\brief Game controller axis motion event structure (event.caxis.*)

\brief An event used to request a file open by the system (event.drop.*) This event is disabled by default, you can enable it with SDL_EventState() \note If you enable this event, you must free the filename in the event.

\brief A video driver dependent system event (event.syswm.*) This event is disabled by default, you can enable it with SDL_EventState()
\note If you want to use this event, you should include SDL_syswm.h.

\name Usage page 0x07
These values are from usage page 0x07 (USB keyboard page).

\name Usage page 0x0C
These values are mapped from usage page 0x0C (USB consumer page).

\name Walther keys
These are values that Christian Walther added (for mac keyboard?).

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2
member.summary: Modified version of Dictionary that uses custom equality comparers to prevente heap allocations on iOS when doing lookups. Can use custom equality comparers. Default comparers for primitives don't generate allocations. Can be iterated and accessed by index. Read by index speed is nearly as fast as a List in a build.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.TryGetKeyAt(System.Int32,`0@)
member.summary: Gets the key at the specified index. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access when the dictionary is full and no items have been removed. Up to 50% faster than GetNext... on a full dictionary.
member.param: The index. Use to get the count for iteration.
member.returns: Returns true if the entry at the index was valid. Returns false if not.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.TryGetValueAt(System.Int32,`1@)
member.summary: Gets the value at the specified index. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access when the dictionary is full and no items have been removed. Up to 50% faster than GetNext... on a full dictionary.
member.param: The index. Use to get the count for iteration.
member.returns: Returns true if the entry at the index was valid. Returns false if not.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.TryGetEntryAt(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Gets the entry at the specified index. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access when the dictionary is full and no items have been removed. Up to 50% faster than GetNext... on a full dictionary.
member.param: The index. Use to get the count for iteration.
member.returns: Returns true if the entry at the index was valid. Returns false if not.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetNextIndex(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the index of the next valid entry. Index is incremented to match the index of the item. Usage: for(int i = -1; dict.GetNextIndex(ref i);) { }
member.param: The index. This should be -1 when starting an iteration at the beginning.
member.returns: Returns true if there was another valid entry found in the collection. Returns false if no valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetNextIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of the next valid entry. Usage: for(int i = dict.IndexOfFirst; dict.TryGetValue(i, out value); i = dict.GetNextIndex(i);) { }
member.returns: Returns the index of the next valid entry in the collection. Returns -1 if no more valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetNextKey(System.Int32@,`0@)
member.summary: Gets the next valid key. Index is incremented to match the index of the item. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access if many entries have been removed from the dictionary because it will skip those that have become invalid without a separate function call for each. Usage: for(int i = -1; dict.GetNextKey(ref i, out key);) { }
member.param: The index. This should be -1 when starting an iteration at the beginning.
member.returns: Returns true if there was another valid entry found in the collection. Returns false if no valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetNextValue(System.Int32@,`1@)
member.summary: Gets the next valid value. Index is incremented to match the index of the item. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access if many entries have been removed from the dictionary because it will skip those that have become invalid without a separate function call for each. Usage: for(int i = -1; dict.GetNextValue(ref i, out value);) { }
member.param: The index. This should be -1 when starting an iteration at the beginning.
member.returns: Returns true if there was another valid entry found in the collection. Returns false if no valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetNextEntry(System.Int32@,System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Gets the next valid entry. Index is incremented to match the index of the item. This is the fastest method to use for indexed access if many entries have been removed from the dictionary because it will skip those that have become invalid without a separate function call for each. Usage: for(int i = -1; dict.GetNextEntry(ref i, out entry);) { }
member.param: The index. This should be -1 when starting an iteration at the beginning.
member.returns: Returns true if there was another valid entry found in the collection. Returns false if no valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetPreviousIndex(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the index of the previous valid entry. Index is incremented to match the index of the item. Usage: for(int i = dict.TotalCount; dict.GetPreviousIndex(ref i);) { }
member.param: The index. This should be set to when starting an iteration at the end.
member.returns: Returns true if there was another valid entry found in the collection. Returns false if no valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.ADictionary`2.GetPreviousIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of the previous valid entry. Usage: for(int i = dict.IndexOfLast; dict.TryGetValue(i, out value); i = dict.GetPreviousIndex(i);) { }
member.returns: Returns the index of the previous valid entry in the collection. Returns -1 if no more valid entries were found.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.ExtensionMethods.IsNullOrDestroyed(System.Object)
member.summary: Used to determine if an interface on an object that inherits from UnityEngine.Object is null or has been destroyed. This is to make up for the fact that the UnityEngine.Object's overloaded == operator does not work on interfaces. This can be called directly on a null object because it's a static extension method.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Utility.ThreadHelper.InvokeActionSync(System.Action)
member.summary: Invokes the incoming Action on the thread synchronously. The calling thread will halt until execution of the Action is finished. If there are other Actions in the queue, all Actions will be processed before execution is resumed in the calling thread.
member.returns: Returns false if the thread is not running or the Action is null.

member.summary: Stops the calling thread execution until all Actions in the queue have finished processing.
